page.title: 05LOCAL HISTORY_COPMANTHORPE
page.content: Copmanthorpe has a village trust,it has set itself the task of watching over the preservation of the village since 1970.A booklet has been written by one of its members Jean Johnson,the Honary Secretary of the trust, detail_ ing the history of the village.In it she tells us that Copmanthorpe derived its name possibly from the Viking word "thorpe"meaning an outlying settlement .Copmanthorpe means the merchant's settlement and it was possibly a rest_ ing place or trading place on the road to York.There is a Roman road which runs along what is now Top Lane.This was part of a Roman Highway which ran from York to Tadcaster eventually joining the main Roman road from Lincoln. (Continued on page 6).
